verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> of Tyre.<WH6865> Howl,<WH3213> you ships<WH591> of Tarshish!<WH8659> For it is laid waste,<WH7703> so that there is no house,<WH1004> no entering in.<WH935> From the land<WH776> of Kittim<WH3794> it is revealed to them.<WH1540>
Be still,<WH1826> you inhabitants<WH3427> of the coast,<WH339> you whom the merchants<WH5503> of Sidon,<WH6721> that pass over<WH5674> the sea,<WH3220> have replenished.<WH4390>
On great<WH7227> waters,<WH4325> the seed<WH2233> of the Shihor,<WH7883> the harvest<WH7105> of the Nile,<WH2975> was her revenue.<WH8393> She was the market<WH5505> of nations.<WH1471>

Be ashamed,<WH954> Sidon;<WH6721> for the sea<WH3220> has spoken,<WH559> the stronghold<WH4581> of the sea,<WH3220> saying,<WH559> "I have not travailed,<WH2342> nor brought forth,<WH3205> neither have I nourished<WH1431> young men,<WH970> nor brought up<WH1431> virgins.<WH1330>"
When the report<WH8088> comes to Egypt,<WH4714> they will be in anguish<WH2342> at the report<WH8088> of Tyre.<WH6865>
Pass over<WH5674> to Tarshish!<WH8659> Wail,<WH3213> you inhabitants<WH3427> of the coast!<WH339>
Is this your joyous<WH5947> city,<WH6927> whose antiquity is of ancient<WH6924> days,<WH3117> whose feet<WH7272> carried<WH2986> her far away<WH7350> to travel?<WH1481>
Who has planned<WH3289> this against Tyre,<WH6865> the giver of crowns,<WH5849> whose merchants<WH5503> are princes,<WH8269> whose traffickers<WH3667> are the honorable<WH3513> of the earth?<WH776>
Yahweh<WH3068> of Armies<WH6635> has planned<WH3289> it,<WH2490> to stain the pride<WH1347> of all glory,<WH6643> to bring into contempt<WH7043> all the honorable<WH3513> of the earth.<WH776>
Pass<WH5674> through your land<WH776> like the Nile,<WH2975> daughter<WH1323> of Tarshish.<WH8659> There is no restraint any more.<WH4206>

He has stretched out<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> over the sea.<WH3220> He has shaken<WH7264> the kingdoms.<WH4467> Yahweh<WH3068> has ordered<WH6680> the destruction<WH8045> of Canaan<WH3667>'s strongholds.<WH4581>

He said,<WH559> "You shall rejoice<WH5937> no more,<WH3254> you oppressed<WH6231> virgin<WH1330> daughter<WH1323> of Sidon.<WH6721> Arise,<WH6965> pass over<WH5674> to Kittim.<WH3794> Even there you will have no rest.<WH5117>"

Behold,<WH776> the land of the Chaldeans.<WH3778> This people<WH5971> was not.<WH804> The Assyrians founded<WH3245> it for those who dwell in the wilderness.<WH6728> They set up<WH6965> their towers.<WH971> They overthrew<WH6209> its palaces.<WH759> They made<WH7760> it a ruin.<WH4654>
Howl,<WH3213> you ships<WH591> of Tarshish,<WH8659> for your stronghold<WH4581> is laid waste!<WH7703>

It will come to pass in that day<WH3117> that Tyre<WH6865> will be forgotten<WH7911> seventy<WH7657> years,<WH8141> according to the days<WH3117> of one<WH259> king.<WH4428> After the end<WH7093> of seventy<WH7657> years<WH8141> it will be to Tyre<WH6865> like in the song<WH7892> of the prostitute.<WH2181>

Take<WH3947> a harp;<WH3658> go about<WH5437> the city,<WH5892> you prostitute<WH2181> that has been forgotten.<WH7911> Make sweet<WH3190> melody.<WH5059> Sing many<WH7235> songs,<WH7892> that you may be remembered.<WH2142>

It will happen after the end<WH7093> of seventy<WH7657> years<WH8141> that Yahweh<WH3068> will visit<WH6485> Tyre,<WH6865> and she shall return<WH7725> to her wages,<WH868> and will play the prostitute<WH2181> with all the kingdoms<WH4467> of the world<WH776> on the surface<WH6440> of the earth.<WH127>

Her merchandise<WH5504> and her wages<WH868> will be holiness<WH6944> to Yahweh.<WH3068> It will not be treasured<WH686> nor laid up;<WH2630> for her merchandise<WH5504> will be for those who dwell<WH3427> before<WH6440> Yahweh,<WH3068> to eat<WH398> sufficiently,<WH7654> and for durable<WH6266> clothing.<WH4374>
